website_summaries.verdict: The Epson WorkForce DS-560 Wireless Color Document Scanner can scan directly to a mobile device, as well as connect to an access point by Wi-Fi to work as a network scanner.
pros: Scans to mobile devices, both directly and through an access point
cons: Doesn't do a good job recognizing text on business cards

customer_reviews.title: Replacing it after two years! Barely used in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Replacing it after two years! Barely used in the last 6 months, because I've spent more time trying to get it to work correctly. After the last major software update, I can't get the scanner application to work correctly. I've reinstalled software, reset the device, removed ALL of the applications, reset and removed registry keys, and done a full dance to the scanning gods. They were probably distracted by others doing the same, and laughing at us when trying to work with Epson support (which is appallingly bad). No Bueno!! The really cruddy thing.... it's the newer software, it's just not compatible with this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Multi-feed Mechanism Failure After Five Months
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this scanner for the first five months, then the multi-feed mechanism started pulling multiple pages through at the same time, always resulting in a 'paper jam'. I've not used the scanner very much. I've probably scanned in about a hundred pages since purchase (six months ago). I followed Epson's suggestions on how to fix multiple document feed problems, but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-Retired

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well, I used to digitize my old photos, it work very well. However, it needs to be air blown often to keep the scanner clean otherwise, the picture has a thin line on the scanned image. So, I recommend, after scan each stack check your image to see if the line exist, then open scanner, blow out and clean with lense wipe. I have scanned over 10K pictures, done that in a 3-hour sitting daily for about 3 weeks. Not too bad... It scans better than my Canon MX920.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeysoft

customer_reviews.title: Perfect self feeding compact scanner - does both sides.
customer_reviews.text: We were sick of paper jamming up the house, and so we invested in this desktop scanner. It's neat, super intuitive to use and can load the hopper with dozens of sheets of paper. The scanner can do both sides so you end up with a nice organized filing system with all your records digitized and backed up. Good investment for the price. They offer ongoing software and firmware updates as well so you can be sure it will stay up to date.
customer_reviews.author: James Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Awkward software, Hardware failed after 4 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.text: The software is awkward to use. My unit failed after 4 1/2 years: it will not load pages for scanning. Epson Tech support in no help: they offered no advice on trouble shooting or corrective actions. I have an older Fujitsu iX-500 that is still working.
customer_reviews.author: Alyosha

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and don't buy this scanner. It took an hour of various configurations to connect it to my wifi. Maybe I'm an idiot, but the instructions were terrible if the auto connect didn't work (which is what happened to me). Once connected, it wouldn't scan. I give up. I already have a Scansnap I bought for my office and this was a less expensive alternative for home. I returned the same day it arrived and ordered another Scansnap
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Wont buy again
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for a few years with very occasional use. Now after the one yr warranty has expired it spits out the first sheet fine then starts making a clicking noise and spits out groups of sheets at one time. Tried cleaning rollers and other things to no avail. I hate it because it was so expensive for no longer than it lasted and I cant find a place within 200 miles to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M

customer_reviews.title: i have tried to get epson support to help and these people dont even speak good english with the audacity to enjoy having you on
customer_reviews.text: This scanner worked well for about 2 months and now it does not even work with the usb connected!! i have tried to get epson support to help and these people dont even speak good english with the audacity to enjoy having you on the phone for hours troubleshooting and will not replace this faulty scanner! good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Sean P.

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it’s great; Otherwise it’s disappointing
customer_reviews.text: When this actually scans, it’s awesome. I bought this scanner over 2 years ago. The WiFi worked for maybe 2 months but that was fine considering my laptop sat next to the scanner. The problem now is the frequency of the jams. When you’re quickly trying to scan documents, I found that this scanner has jammed more often over the past year. Now, it jams with more than one sheet, so it requires scanning one sheet at a time. And yes, I followed the recommended maintenance. I expected more from Epson and more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Amzing product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Product! - Easy to use - Effective - Helps to get organized - Fast - High Quality (color & b&w) I bought this product because I decided that 2015 would mean making my office "green". Therefore no paper. This is wireless and I just move it on my desk when I need to use it and scan away. I love the whole concept of it. I also like that it is very compact and attractive to look at. When you are not using it, it folds up and out of the way (see picture). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Does way more than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!!!! This is a superfast unit... Scans double-sided, zips through pages and pages extremely quickly. It also did some pretty crumpled receipts. It's so light and little that it really doesn't seem like it can do much when you first get it. Very pleasantly surprising!!! I've been converting to all digital, getting rid of the years of paperwork for my small business and my personal stuff. Eliminated the need for a file drawer in my home office!

customer_reviews.title: I love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner, it works great with my iPhone and Galaxy; however, I am having some issues with Windows 10. I have installed it, but I cannot get the documents scanned directly to the computers.

customer_reviews.title: Beware awful software!
customer_reviews.text: I have spent 2 days getting this scanner to connect to my computer. This software is some of the most poorly designed I have ever seen. I have had numerous printers as well as other devices put on a wireless network, and never have I had such difficulty. The scanner software itself is very primitive and hard to use. I cannot believe anyone in this day and age would release software that was so poorly executed. Even worse, it does not let me scan with my Apple Preview software which has worked with every other scanner I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Musikantow

customer_reviews.title: I bought the fujitsu scansnap ix500 (which apparently is a great scanner), but it does not have "wifi-direct" capability ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to go directly from a scanner to your mobile device, this unit has that capability, without the need for a access point (which apparently is a wifi network). I bought the fujitsu scansnap ix500 (which apparently is a great scanner), but it does not have "wifi-direct" capability and requires a wifi network/access point. In other words, if you are in the middle of the desert and you only have your smartphone and this Espon scanner (with a power supply), you can still scan directly to your phone because it has wifi direct.

I was planning to do this on the snowy winter days in NY but we haven't had any yet.... maybe next week!

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, interface needs some user friendliness.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent midlevel business scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I set this scanner up to allow a car dealership to conform to the DMV's requirements for electronic copies of paper signatures, and it has handled the job admirably. This scanner has been able to process anything I've thrown at it and doesn't mind flimsy copies or long forms. Perfect size and speed for a business with about 50 employees.

customer_reviews.title: Useless on a network

The epson network config S/W sees the scanner, ping sees the scanner, a web browser sees the scanner but the scanning S/W does not. Very frustrating. Save yourself a lot of trouble, buy another brand.

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce DS-560 Wireless Color Document Scanner for PC and Mac, Auto Document Feeder (ADF), Duplex Scanning
product_meta.description: Welcome to the next generation of efficiency for fast-paced businesses — featuring the WorkForce DS-560 document scanner. Wirelessly scan critical documents to smartphones, tablets or computers; or scan to cloud services. This powerful scanner offers everything you need to manage business documents. Save time, and even save space. Delivering speeds up to 26 ppm, the compact DS-560 can breeze through any task. Easily create searchable PDFs3 or make color and image adjustments. Its 50-page Auto Document Feeder allows you to scan stacks of documents. Compatible with most professional document management systems, the reliable DS-560 supports ISIS and TWAIN drivers.
feature_bullets: Save time — wirelessly scan critical documents to your smartphone, tablet, PC or Mac, or popular cloud services.
Do more — 26 ppm/52 ipm scan speeds; scans both sides in just one pass.
Scan to searchable PDFs — scan and edit documents; save scanned documents as PDF files; OCR software included.
Save on office space — compact scanner fits almost anywhere.
Scan to popular cloud services — scan to Evernote, Google Drive, SharePoint, SugarSync and more.
